pageTitle: UNHWildcats.com -- University of New Hampshire Official Athletics Website:Mike MacArthur
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {29442=2014- Inducted into National College Athletic Honor Society, Chi Sigma Alpha , 29647=2013 - Photos 2013 Statistics  Started all 15 games for the wildcats as the place kicker this season... best field goal percentage in CAA (.900), fourth in field goals/game (1.12), fifth in scoring among all CAA kickers (48pts), and ninth in points/game in the CAA (6.0)... made 15 of 20 field goals (.750) and 41 of 44 (.932) extra points throughout the season... had multiple perfect kicking games, made both field goals and the only extra point against Lehigh, again against Towson making both extra points... had 3 double digit scoring games, scoring 10 points against Villanova with a field goal and 7 extra points... a season high 13 points with another season high 3 field goals and 4 extra points... scored 11 points on 2 field goals, one being knocked in from a season best 43 yards, and 5 extra points against Maine in the second round of the NCAA playoffs... Named to the CAA Academic All-Conference Team and recieved the team's Eugene K. Auerbach Student-Athlete Award, 34132=2010 2010 Statistics Received 2010-11 CAA Commissioner's Academic Award ... named to CAA Academic All-Conference Team ... named to All-CAA Third Team ... was only true freshman to see game action ... went 10-for-13 in field-goal kicking, with a high of 47 yards at Maine ... successfully converted all 24 PATs ... led team with 54 points ... had one punt for 31 yards at Rhode Island ... kicked a 23-yard field goal in NCAA D-I quarterfinal loss at No. 5 Delaware ... connected for 31-yard field goal in victory over Towson ... went 1-for-2 with a 40-yard field goal in loss to No. 4 William & Mary ... hit 2 of 2 field goals, a 25-yarder and a 30-yarder, in triumph at No. 6 James Madison ... drilled 34-yard field goal in win over No. 11 Richmond ... successfully hit 2 of 3 field goals, including career-high 47-yard try, in loss at Maine ... hit only field-goal attempt, from 37 yards away, in win over Lehigh ... went 1-for-1 with a 26-yard field goal at Rhode Island., 35285=Career Highs: Field Goals    Most    3, vs Villanova, 2011     Longest    47, 2x, last at UMass, 2011 PATs    Most    7, at Old Dominion, 2012 Kickoffs    Most    10, at Old Dominion, 2012 Punts    Longest    71, at Maine, 2012     Most    7, at Maine, 2012, 28636=Personal The son of David and Amy MacArthur ... born 2-7-91 in Portsmouth, N.H., 31000=2012 2012 Statistics Named to All-CAA Third Team and College Sports Madness All-CAA Third Team … named to CAA Academic All-Conference Team and received CAA Commissioner’s Academic Award … served as starting place kicker and punter, appearing in all 12 games … ranked third in CAA in Field Goals/game (0.92) and seventh in CAA in PAT Kicking % (82.6) … ranked sixth in league in scoring/game (5.9 points) … went 11 of 14 in field-goal attempts, with a long of 43 yards (at Georgia State, Oct. 6) … went 38-for-46 in PATs … led Wildcats with 71 points … punted 47 times for 1,651 yards, averaging 35.1 yards/punt with a long of 71 yards at Maine (Oct. 20) … scored season-high 13 points at Old Dominion (Sept. 22) by going 2-for-2 in FGs and 7-for-7 in PATs … named CAA & ECAC Special Teams Player of Week after hitting 27-yard field goal, going 5-for-5 in PATs and drilling 51-yard punt in win over Richmond (Oct. 13) … named to Phil Steele's Preseason All-CAA Second Team at kicker; ranked preseason No. 10 kicker nationally ... placed on CFPA Placekicker Award Watch List ... named to College Sports Madness Preseason All-CAA Second Team 2011 2011 Statistics Named All-CAA Second Team kicker ... received CAA Commissioner's Academic Award ... member of 2011 CAA Academic All-Conference Team ... played in all 12 games, serving as starting place kicker and punter ... went 15-for-18 (83.3%) in field-goal attempts, with a long of 47 yards ... converted 40 of 43 PATs ... led Wildcats with 85 points ... punted 40 times for 1,532 yards, averaging 38.3 yards/punt with a long of 59 yards ... kicked 36-yard field goal in NCAA second-round playoff loss at Montana State ... booted 32-yard field goal in win against Maine ... kicked a 36-yard field goal and a 21-yard FG in win over James Madison ... named Beyond Sports Network Punter of the Week for 59-yard punt and 49.5 yards/punt average in win over Rhode Island; also kicked a 28-yard field goal ... tied career high with 47-yard field goal at Gillette Stadium in Colonial Clash triumph vs UMass; added 35-yard FG ... drilled 37-yard field goal in loss at William & Mary ... set career high with three FGs -from 24 yards, 27 yards and 23 yards- in win over Villanova ... kicked 25-yard FG in win against Holy Cross ... hit 23-yard field goal in win at Richmond ... connected for 25-yard and 35-yard FGs in OT win at Lehigh, the latter tied the game late in fourth quarter; also was named CFPA Punter of the Week Honorable Mention after punting four times (long of 57) for 186 yards (46.5 yards/punt) ... tabbed to CFPA D-I FCS Watch List during preseason, 35944=Before UNH Attended Phillips Exeter Academy as post-graduate student ... graduated in top 10 percent of the Winnacunnet High School class of 2009 ... accepted into the National Honors Society as a Junior ... two-year kicker/punter for the WHS varsity football team ... took 26 punts as a senior, averaging 40 yards per punt with a 2.5 yard average return ... had a long punt of 60 yards ... made 29 out of 32 PATs (1 missed, 2 blocked) ... hit 4 out of 5 field goals with a long of 39 yards in wet muddy conditions ... four-year starter on the Winnacunnet soccer team and voted captain as a senior}
